Name: Introduction
Description:
This document does double service as a test for `pylingdocs` and a showcase of its capabilities.
It aims to demonstrate every feature and model currently available in `pylingdocs`.

Name: Common markdown
Description:
You can use all the familiar markdown components.
Here is a link to the [pylingdocs github repo](https://github.com/fmatter/pylingdocs/).
Here is some **bold** and _italic_ and **_bold italic_** text.

1. here
2. is
3. a
4. numbered
3. list

and of course here is

* and one
* with
* bullet points[^3]

A quote:

> Locating an individual language on a given point of the ergativity-nominativity axis and the diachronic interpretation of this axis seem to be conceptually different concerns, even if we were to assume that there are principies favouring one direction over the other. ([alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split): 71)

[^3]: And here is a (foot)note. You can use markdown in here: see [crossref](chapters.csv?_anchor=sec:data&label=Other linguistic data#cldf:sec:data) for details about [Morpheme apa-se](morphemes.csv?#cldf:apa-se).

Name: Pylingdocs markdown
Description:
Apart from database references, discussed in [crossref](chapters.csv?_anchor=sec:sources&label=Citing literature#cldf:sec:sources), there are a number of `pylingdocs`-specific commands, all patterning like links: * cross-references: [crossref](chapters.csv?_anchor=common-markdown&label=Common markdown#cldf:common-markdown) or [crossref](chapters.csv?_anchor=sec:intro&label=Introduction#cldf:sec:intro), see corresponding `label` commands * example references: * single * subexample * range: * or bare: * glosses: acc * todos: ❗️ * tables (with automatically generated table labels like ref):
Consonant phonemes of Yawarana
| | bilabial | alveolar | palatal | velar | glottal | |:----------|:-----------|:-----------|:----------|:--------|:----------| | occlusive | /p / | /t / | /t͡ʃ/ | /k/ | | | nasal | /m / | /n / | /j/ | | | | fricative | | /s / | | | /j / | | liquid | | /r / | | | | | glide | /w / | | /y/ | | | * figures (with automatically generated table labels like ref): [Cognate identification strategy: cognates.jpg]

Name: Other linguistic data
Description:
## Native CLDF components

* forms: [Form tri-house](FormTable?#cldf:tri-house)
* languages: [Language hix](LanguageTable?#cldf:hix)
* cognate sets:

[Cognate set louse-1](CognatesetTable?#cldf:louse-1)

## Non-native components

[Morph tri-se-3](morphs.csv?#cldf:tri-se-3) is a variant of [Morpheme tri-se](morphemes.csv?no_translation#cldf:tri-se).
Neither occur on [Wordform tri-fire](wordforms.csv?#cldf:tri-fire), because it is a noun.
They are related to [Morpheme apa-se,way-se](morphemes.csv?no_translation&ids=apa-se,way-se#cldf:__all__).
This is thus a cognate set shared by [Language apa,way,tri](LanguageTable?ids=apa,way,tri#cldf:__all__).

* If [Wordform tri-kure](wordforms.csv?#cldf:tri-kure) has too long a translation, try [Wordform tri-kure](wordforms.csv?translation=good#cldf:tri-kure).

* This dataset contains the [Language ikp](LanguageTable?#cldf:ikp) text [Text ikp-ekiri](texts.csv?#cldf:ikp-ekiri).

Name: Citing literature
Description:
* see [alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split) or [alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split): 133-134
* with parentheses:
    * "Locating an individual language on a given point of the ergativity-nominativity axis and the diachronic interpretation of this axis seem to be conceptually different concerns" ([alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split))
    * "Locating an individual language on a given point of the ergativity-nominativity axis and the diachronic interpretation of this axis seem to be conceptually different concerns" ([alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split): 71)
* multiple citations:
    * [alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split): 133-134, [triomeira1999](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:triomeira1999): 218
    * ([alvarez1998split](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:alvarez1998split): 133-134, [triomeira1999](sources.bib?with_internal_ref_link&ref#cldf:triomeira1999): 218)
